articles.author: Barry Svrluga
articles.title: There's still a place for Ryan Zimmerman on the Nats. Get the deal done.
articles.description: The franchise’s original cornerstone still has value to the Nats beyond nostalgia.
articles.content: Given all the heroes on hand for the Washington Nationals Winterfest, the players lot along the first base line filled with a few shiny, high-end vehicles. Walking past, though, you had to wonder: If Ryan Zimmerman drove up and pulled out his old ID from the … [+5786 chars]

articles.author: Jerome Pugmire | AP
articles.title: Dembélé scores again as Lyon wins at Bordeaux to go 5th
articles.description: A fine finish from coveted striker Moussa Dembélé and a deflected effort from Maxwell Cornet helps Lyon rally to win 2-1 at Bordeaux in the French league
articles.content:
Veteran forward Jimmy Briand put Bordeaux ahead in the 15th against his former club.
The win moved Lyon up to fifth place and Dembélé grabbed his 14th goal in 28 games.
With Netherlands forward Memphis Depay likely out for the rest of the season as he recov… [+1267 chars]

articles.author: Jonathan Lemire, Deb Riechmann and Aamer Madhani | AP
articles.title: Iran standoff shines spotlight on new Trump security adviser
articles.description: In a defining week for Donald Trump, his national security adviser was a constant presence at the president's side as the U.S. edged to the brink of war with Iran and back
articles.content: While former national security adviser John Bolton spent decades as a conservative iconoclast in the public arena, OBrien is far from a household name. While Bolton had strong opinions he shared loudly in the Oval Office, OBrien has worked to establish an ami… [+6784 chars]

articles.author: Dan Balz
articles.title: Two polls frame the Democratic race and the power of African American voters
articles.description: Sanders’s rise in Iowa highlights the aspirations of the party’s progressive wing. A Post-Ipsos poll underscores Biden’s dependence on black voters.
articles.content: At the time, former vice president Joe Bidens performance on the trail and in debates was raising doubts about his candidacy. But this Democrat, who only wanted to assess the race without being identified, said he remained reasonably bullish about Bidens chan… [+5956 chars]

articles.author: Ian Livingston
articles.title: Deadly severe weather outbreak slices across the South as snow and ice paste parts of the northern tier
articles.description: Ahead of the storm, record, springlike warmth covers the East Coast.
articles.content:
Parts of the South are bracing for another day of violent thunderstorms as residents from the Plains to the Canadian border face a sudden wintry blast unloading snow and ice.
Thunderstorms with damaging winds continue to spread east into Alabama and Georgia,… [+5047 chars]

articles.author: Sharif Hassan, Susannah George
articles.title: Two American service members killed in Taliban-claimed attack
articles.description: The attack in Afghanistan comes as formal peace talks between American and Taliban negotiators are stalled over demands for a reduction in violence.
articles.content:
Ataullah Ata, a member of the Kandahar provincial council, said the attack occurred in the Dand district and left the American vehicle completely destroyed.
Ata said U.S. forces based at Kandahar air base regularly patrol nearby villages, including in the Da… [+2035 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: UK police say it was mistake to call climate group extremist
articles.description: British police say they were wrong to include environmental protest group Extinction Rebellion on a list of extremist organizations in an official document
articles.content:
The guide said that while concern about climate change is not in itself extreme, activists may encourage vulnerable people to perform acts of violence.
The Guardian said in its Saturday edition that the document, dated November 2019, was distributed to teach… [+944 chars]
